events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover unexpected medical expenses incurred during a recent surgery.
The application was reviewed by the system and correctly categorised as a personal loan based on keywords related to medical expenses.
A loan officer with experience in personal loans and medical-related financing was assigned to assist the applicant through the process.
The loan officer completed an initial review of the application, verifying the completeness of submitted information and medical documentation.
Additional documents were requested from the applicant, including detailed medical bills and proof of income for accurate risk assessment.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documents, including detailed medical reports and latest pay stubs for income verification.
A credit check was conducted revealing a good credit score with some previous minor debt, consistent with the applicant's credit history.
Risk assessment indicated a manageable risk level given the applicant's stable income and good credit history despite current medical expenses.
An offer for a personal loan with competitive interest rates and flexible repayment terms was presented to the applicant.
The applicant responded positively to the loan offer, appreciating the clear terms and repayment flexibility provided.
Due to the loan amount requested exceeding the initial threshold, the application was escalated to senior management for approval.
Senior management approved the personal loan after thorough review, citing the applicantâ€™s strong credit and supporting documentation.
The personal loan amount was disbursed to the applicant's bank account, enabling payment of outstanding medical bills without delay.
A follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant was satisfied with the loan process and had no issues managing repayments.
The loan application case was officially closed after confirming all loan funding and post-approval activities were completed successfully.
